Das Spiel hat eigentlich ein gutes Konzept. Jedoch machen die "Pay to Win" Hunter das Spiel nicht besser, zudem viele Hunter (die, die Lobby hosten) eine mittel bis schlechte Internetverbindung besitzen. Dies f√ºhrt wiederum zu vielen Lags die ich schon mehr als oft miterleben musste. Hier 2 Beispiele: 
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S3aS_YSKa2s 
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPj64Bs4Kbg

Das Spiel ist durch immer unbesiegbarere Killer (muss √ºberteuert gekauft werden) definitiv in den Ruin getrieben worden. Au√üerdem ist es fast unm√∂glich, auf einer Map zu gewinnen, wenn der Host (Killer) ein schlechtes Internet hat. Definitiv kein fairer Ausgleich mehr.
@Cool: Die Ping Anzeige bringt nicht viel, wenn sie am Anfang gr√ºn ist und w√§hrend des Spiels das Internet des Killers erstmal in den Keller geht

Tr√®s bon jeu.

Les + :
- Excellentes m√©caniques de jeu
- Une grande vari√©t√© d'atouts, tueurs et survivants
- Les DLC ne sont pas trop cher √† mon sens. 3.99‚Ç¨ pour un tueur seul et 6.99‚Ç¨ pour un Chapitre Survivant & Tueur, chacun avec ses nouveaux atout.
- Les d√©veloppeurs sont √† l'√©coute, il y a du contenu tout les +- 3 mois et des mises √† jour tout les mois.
- Bonne dur√©e de vie, j'estime qu'il vous faudra au moins 300H ou plus pour d√©bloquer l'int√©gralit√© des comp√©tences enseignables de tout les survivants/tueurs.

Les - :
- Communaut√© qui peut parfois se montrer tr√®s toxique si vous aimez jouer tueur. Pr√©parez vous √† encaisser des "fck you camper","gg ez", teabbag et autres lampes torches dans la t√™te √† chaque partie au dela du rang 10-14. Conseil: Jouer tueur est plaisant √† bas rang, mais tr√®s √©nervant √† haut rang.
- Parfois vous rencontrerez des tueurs toxiques, qui vous campent jusqu'a la mort ou vous focus afin d'en finir avec vous d√®s que possible. Cela s'av√®re cependant plus rare, car la plupart des joueurs tueurs cherchent √† garder l'exp√©rience plaisante pour tous.

Selon moi, c'est un bon jeu qui vaut son prix. Foncez si vous √™tes int√©r√©ss√© ! Vous ne le regrettrez pas !

As of 2/9/2021, I can no longer recommend Dead By Daylight

A complete overhaul of core aesthetics to the game has taken update as of today, which in the wake of Dead By Daylight's buggiest states it's seen in years, goes to show that the Developers have little to no care for this game. I've never complained about bugs because I had faith the developers would work to fix them, but with the new overhaul to UI and animations, I cannot express my disappointment enough. The new changes make the game look like a donkey's anus, and still a constant bombardment of bug complaints + this shit, the community should speak up. The current Heads of development at Behavior release new skins and buggy DLC's because it makes them money, not fixing anything in return. It's been a good <5 year run for me, I bought this 2 weeks after release back in 2016. I cannot in any faith recommend this game in it's current state.

EDIT: They released Hellraiser's Pinhead + the Chatterer (!!!), cannot have loved this news enough. I even considered looking past everything to be able to play Pinhead, but then the news that buying his DLC would come with an NFT.. what did I expect. Devs really loved the double edged sword metaphor. One bad thing after another, still have yet to stop the NFTs. Not even Hellraiser is worth that.

What to say about dead by daylight oh I know its awful, the devs are some of the worst you have ever seen, the game is riddled with bugs the game is so survivor sided that if you pick any other killer besides billy and nurse its like signing over you win chances to the survivors. Dead By Daylight could be described as a reverse Evolve, as this is a game where a selection of overpowered monsters hunt humans while they try to turn on generators, allowing them to escape. On paper, it sounds like a great time, but in execution, it is mostly dreadful.

First off, the survivors have no offense against the monsters whatsoever. As a survivor, you're expected to hide in tall grass/trees/corn or juke whoever is playing as the killer while simultaneously turning on loud generators. These generators take seemingly minutes to turn on, which consists of holding the right bumper while also pressing the left bumper for random timed quick-time events; failing to do so will cause a loud pop that alerts the killer to your location. Aside from that, the only other things survivors can do is heal each other, hide in randomly placed and oddly empty closets, and toss down debris while running from the killer. 

Unlike survivors that play with a third-person camera, the killer is played in first-person, thus allowing survivors to have a chance at juking. Each killer has their own special ability like being able to teleport, turn invisible, and so on; not that they need them because just running around and attacking using gets the job done considering survivors take two hits to down. Once a survivor is downed, killers must carry their squirming bodies to conveniently placed meathooks around the map and impale them there where they will struggle for a bit before some kind of hellish monstrosity reaches down from the sky and carries them off. 

In my experience, survivors rarely escape due to just how overpowered the killers feel. While I understand that Dead By Daylight is heavily influenced by horror movies, it doesn't make for much of a compelling game to have the cards stacked against survivors in the same way as in said films. On top of that, those playing as a killer seem to earn credits to spend far faster than survivors, even if they escape.

In-game credits can be used to unlock various items for characters that give them a better chance at surviving or killing; as if the killers need any help. There is also a leveling and prestige system in place, as well as seasons for ranks, though I'm not quite sure why anyone would care about those things; the game sure doesn't give you a reason to, or at least one it tells you about..

The game doesn't give you much advice or guidance at all. There is no training or tutorial aside from a bunch of text on-screen that must be manually flipped through and read if you hope to understand how to play at all. I could understand the developers forgoing a more engaging tutorial if this were a tried-and-true formula such as a platformer, but it isn't. I made the mistake of just jumping into a game and being completely and utterly at a loss for what my objective was, which is never a good look.  game so fun with your Friend  that my Reviewing for this game .

I used to not recommend this game since things started to drift a bit south after the introduction of what I call are the killers most undesirable survivor perks(DS,BT,Etc).
BUT,(and that is a huge but) I think DbD is getting better after the Clown & Spirt releases.
The new perks the killers got are spicing things up a bit.
And the killer Buffs were long overdue.
As long as behavior doesn't give killer mains a big middle finger in the next upcoming patches. Things will be gravy from here on out.
So, I can honestly say that I like this game again.
And, you should too!
Just don't be Toxic and be noice and you'll see others do the same for you.

Big fan of indie and horror, here's my input:

+ Nice depth and variety of serial killers (and survivors) to pick from, each with their own lore/background or Hollywood-inspired themes
+ Perks (abilities of characters/killers) are pretty detailed and significant in many ways to help teammates out
+ Maps are pretty nice and fit the practical environments in which killers would normally go around murdering people (some are adapted from movies too that fit with DLC content)
+ All DLC maps and killers are able to be used against non-DLC players (and vice-versa)
+ Customization is pretty cool, not as beautiful visually but still appealing to those interested in gory stuff
+ Game is pretty solid for optimization (a lot of low-end PCs may be able to withstand lag or high pings, but it's manageable depending on your specs)
+ Cosmetics can be bought from store, with either in-game currency (somewhat efficient enough to grind for) or just buying them with real money straight up

- Game is somewhat tailored towards killers at times (they get the upper hand and easy advantages in capturing survivors, killing them, hooking, etc.; in other words, they are able to tunnel around and stop you pretty fast, even when you think running speed wouldn't matter much in the game)
- Survivors have very little chance to escape at times (tying into my previous contention); you need to collaborate well
- Collaboration and communication is really lackluster (voice chat in-game doesn't exist so you must rely on each other in a difficult way to complete objectives like generators, for example); coordination works best through Discord or whatever
- If a random in your team thinks they are about to get hooked, or they just get pinned down easily without help, they'll just disconnect and not bother, which leads to an even more frustrating match
- The only easy way to acquie bloodpoints (experience) and items without worrying about randoms is to literally queue up with friends on SWF mode
- Many perks of characters (especially the DLC survivors) need to be revamped or buffed to meet present killer criteria
- Killers host the games, and if their ping is too high, you will also suffer enormously in game with latency issues (I've faced this myself several dozen times)
- Community in-game is a little toxic (especially the killers who try to talk shit when you're in a post-game lobby because you won and they lost, so they blame it on you and the randoms for being successful against them in a 4vs1 asymmetrical game anyways)
- The DLC packs for the game (which you don't really need unless you prefer killers and their perks) are a bit pricey, at around $7 per bundle.

Overall, would highly recommend to anyone interested in horror-type games, and definitely worth the purchase still. It's well done so far and I expect even better content this year. I would highly recommend, however, that you have some friends with you to enjoy this game fully.

Cuando haces prestigio con un personaje deber√≠an conservarse las 3 habilidades propias del personaje. Eso ayudar√≠a. Tambi√©n deber√≠an poderse desactivar las habilidades ense√±ables desbloqueadas. Hay habilidades ense√±ables bastante malas que nadie quiere. 

La habilidad No Mither deber√≠a ser como tiempo prestado. La ventaja: no dejar charcos de sangre ni gru√±idos. La desventaja: un golpe activa una cuenta atr√°s para caer al suelo (que aumenta con el nivel de la habilidad). Reconozc√°moslo, es la peor habilidad del juego tal y como est√°

El tiempo prestado no deber√≠a perderse si tras el periodo de tiempo ninguno sufre un golpe. Es una skill que a veces sirve y a veces ocupa espacio y se pierde de forma tonta. 

Los mapas son los peores items del juego. Nadie los quiere. Un rework estar√≠a bien. Deber√≠an guardar la posici√≥n de todos los generadores, pertenencias del asesino, totems, trampilla y puertas de salida si pasas a su lado. 

Los ganchos saboteados deber√≠an romperse al intentar colgar a un superviviente. El superviviente cae al suelo y pierde algo de su progresi√≥n en liberarse del agarre del asesino. A partir de este momento es cuando el timer del gancho comienza. Esto deber√≠a estar limitado a 1 vez por gancho. Los survivors deber√≠an ver qu√© ganchos est√°n saboteados (no visible para el killer). Actualmente sabotear es inutil y s√≥lo favorece al killer. 

Adem√°s de esto y los t√≠picos bugs y lagazos es un buen juego. Seguid con el trabajo

My absolute FAVORITE game EVER. I'm addicted to it. I recommend it to any true horror fan.

Also, don't be a killer main or a survivor main. Learn to play and appreciate BOTH sides. I play both killer/survivor 50/50 and I get much more enjoyment out of this game now.

I'm only a few hours in and I'm already hooked. If you enjoy L4D2 due to its unique play-style and teamwork aspects, then you'll love this game. The asymmetrical setup provides a new and refreshing experience. It's easy to learn, and doesn't require crazy aim and reflexes like a FPS. Dead by Daylight is a slashing good time.
